page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY KINNERTON
page.content: AREA OF PREHISTORIC ACTIVITY-THREE STANDING STONES,IRON AGE HILL FORT, 2 TUMULI & A CASTLE MOUND AT KINNERTON GOOD SECTIONS OF OFFA'S DYKE IN EAST, 8TH CENTURY.CHARLES I PASSED THROUGH IN 1645 TURNING RIGHT AT RAILS GATE (ROYAL'S GATE 1841 CENSUS) AREA WAS COVERED BY LARGE ESTATES,NEWCASTLE COURT & EVANCOYD.MYNORS FAMILY OF EVANCOYD BUILT EVENJOBB SCHOOL 1863, CLOSED 1971.THERE WAS A BAPTIST SCHOOL IN EVENJOBB & A DAME SCHOOL IN KINNERTON OLD SHOP.KINNERTON COMMON WAS ENCLOSED IN 1813,EVENJOBB HILL ENCLOSED IN 185O.THERE WERE 2 BLACK- SMITHS,A WHEELWRIGHT & A WORKING MILL IN LIVING MEMORY.THERE ARE SEVERAL DROVERS ROADS IN THE AREA.
